meanings.definition: Measuring little from front to back or from top to bottom.
meanings.sent1: The paper was the thinnest in the stack.
meanings.sent2: She wore the thinnest dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The thinnest book on the shelf was titled 'Short Stories'.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as thin as the thinnest ice.
meanings.sent5: The thinnest thread held the kite in the sky.

meanings.definition: Having little extent between surfaces or sides.
meanings.sent1: The thinnest slice of cake was enough for me.
meanings.sent2: He chose the thinnest piece of wood for the project.
meanings.sent3: The thinnest pancake in the batch was oddly shaped.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was as thin as the thinnest wire.
meanings.sent5: The thinnest layer of paint barely covered the wall.

meanings.sent1: Her hair was the thinnest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The ice on the pond was the thinnest in years.
meanings.sent3: The thinnest soup in the menu was surprisingly flavorful.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were as thin as the thinnest paper.
meanings.sent5: The thinnest cloud in the sky seemed almost transparent.
